Pre-Game Insights: Having won the previous two T20I fixtures comprehensively, Suryakumar Yadav-led Indian team have already won the series.
The Men in Blue will face Sri Lanka in the third T20I on 30 July, Tuesday at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium, looking to inflict a clean sweep.
Under new coach Gautam Gambhir, India began the T20I series against Sri Lanka with a 43-run victory.
Captain Suryakumar won the Player of the Match award for his half-century that helped India score 213/7 while Rishabh Pant slammed 49 off 33.
In reply, Sri Lanka folded for 170 despite a 79-run valiant knock from Pathum Nissanka.
